name: Hotel Sloth Backpackers Bed & Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hostel is a little place in Santa Elena run by Yorle, a local lady. We had a ncie time staying here - it's clean, quiet and the rooms are comfortable. Nice kitchen which you are free to use, free coffee and tea all day, fast WIFI and a decent breakfast. Ticks all the boxes really.
reviews.title: Relaxing place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's not a party hostel, so if you're 19 and looking to stay up drinking, it's not that kinds of place, but that suited us fine (we're 29 and 30). Because it's a small hostel you end up chatting to the other guests in the kitchen and meeting some interesting people.
reviews.title: “Amazingly friendly staff, relaxed atmosphere, unbeatable price.”

reviews.text: Breakfast is sufficient, normally toast with 1 egg and fruit, or pancakes with syrup and fruit, that kinda thing.
reviews.title: Great place!

reviews.text: Yorle works hard at the hostel to please the guests - she makes the breakfast in the mornings, then cleans the entire hostel. On top of this she's always happy to help with booking tours etc. A few of the reviews have mentioned her being pushy with booking tours. I didn't really find her over-pushy. I mean, she is running a business and the price is the same with her as with a tour agency so it makes sense to just book there. We booked ours through her and had 2 great experiences, the Night Walk and the Canopy Tour.
reviews.title: Good place to stay

reviews.text: Overall a good stay at Sloth. It's a nice, new little hostel and deserves to do well.
reviews.title: We had so much fun at sloth backpackers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited the Sloth Backpackers in March and were quite happy with it. close to town and activities. The staff: Gabi and Yorle were incredibly helpful in telling us everything there was to do in the area, recommending restaurants, booking us on a night walking tour and more activides en the recepcion!! Good prices
reviews.title: “Clean, comfortable and affordable!!! Nice and friendly place to stay”

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is also very good!!!
reviews.title: “Nice b&b with extraordinary friendly staff and delicious breakfast”

reviews.text: Sloth Backpackers, was immaculately cared for, the breakfasts were delicious, the room very comfortable and clean and one of the most wonderful hosts that we encountered during our Costa Rican trip!!!
reviews.title: Very good and Pura Vida !!!

reviews.text: The rooms are basic but good and great value for money. I also enjoyed the breakfast with a more then plenty amount of delicious pancakes and fresh fruits.
reviews.title: Don't stay here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms and breakfast was great, but what really did the stay special was the friendly and helpful staff - and not the least the fantastic complimentary tea and coffee :) Free all day.
reviews.title: Good place to spend a night or two

reviews.text: me and 2 friends were looking for a nice place to stay for a nite on the cheap. we ended up staying for two nites cuz we loved the town so much and Gaby was MOST HELPFUL, friendly and accommodating. she set us up with a couple of different tours that were wonderful and for a great price. was a safe place, very clean, showers were good, the beds OK, breakfast is nice (made with love by gaby!), and we LOVED eating at Gaby's mom's "soda" restaurant just further up the street, too ("amistad"). this was a really cute place for a great price! Gaby is so sweet and we enjoyed getting to know her and the community she is part of. i highly recommend it if you are something of a "backpacker" and want a nice clean cheap place.
reviews.title: we found a gem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: small hostel but we liked it. the rooms were colorful and clean. the breakfast was good and the coffee was some of the best we had during our entire trip. Yorle was very helpful (y muy bonita). her mamas restaurant down the street was good and cheaper than most places in town
reviews.title: good choice

reviews.text: Really cute little hostel with a very nice and helpful owner! If you sleep in the dorm you will sleep on matraces, in the double rooms on beds. Breakfast (pancakes with fruits or toast and eggs) is included. I really enjoyed the familiar atmosphere and the sloth you can see making its way on the electric line with a bit of luck =)
reviews.title: Slothbackpackers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Monteverde was our first stop in Costa Rica. Yorlenny and Gaby were excellent hosts. So excellent that we had trouble finding a place anywhere else in Costa Rica that was as awesome for anywhere near the same price. The hostel was simple but, clean and comfortable. Yorlenny lives there and cooks breakfast each morning. The two sisters were very helpful with directions, booking tours, and my horrible spanish. I cannot say enough good things about this place. :)
reviews.title: Best B&B in Costa Rica

reviews.text: All what you need you will find there. We had an excellent service for a small or low price. Very friendly and helpful owners. The rooms are very small but very clean. If you don't look for a luxury hotel...this is the right place to explore the beautiful landscape of Monteverde.
reviews.title: The best price for an excellent.service

reviews.text: The sisters who run this place really do their best to make you feel at home. The long list of houserules are all reasonable and I was just amazed by what kind of stupid people there must be able to travel at all.
reviews.title: Warm and welcoming place in windy Santa Elena

reviews.text: The breakfast is delicious and you can even set the time you want. Rooms and shared bathrooms are all clean and the tours are easily arranged, even the ones that are not in their regular offers, you can just ask them to make the reservation and they will at the same price you get anywhere else.
reviews.title: Organized!

reviews.text: I had a bit of trouble with the hard beds. The matrasses are thin and I am not overweight but slim, so you might reconsider sleeping here if you are keen on a good matrass. Coming from Gringo Pete´s in La Fortuna, the price was a bit of a shock: double for equal facilities. Nevertheless I stayed here with pleasure.
reviews.title: Nothing like the reviews.

reviews.text: We stayed at Sloth Backpackers for 3 nights. Yorli and Gabby arranged all of the things we did in Monteverde and Santa Elena, and even had shuttles pick us up at the hostel. I enjoyed a Manicure. This was the first hostel featuring hot water that we enjoyed in Costa Rica.
reviews.title: Best Hostel

reviews.text: Breakfast was included and it was excellent. Everything is very close by in town, walking distance. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Los mejores panqueques del mundo , un lugar encantador..

aka: Hotel Sloth Backpackers Bed & Breakfast Monteverde, Costa Rica - Santa Elena
description: Hotel Sloth Backpackers B & B is one the most famous hotels in thegateway to all touristic venues in Santa Elena of Monteverde. Personalattention by Owner YORLEWe are the number one option for backpackers and travelers in Costa Rica.In the Town, without Noise.The Hotel Sloth Backpackers B&B is in the perfect place to stay andrelax after a busy day of activities.Offers clean, Dorms and comfortable rooms, and each room has a private bathroomwith hot water 24 hours & Dorms with Bathrooms, towells, FreeInternet or Wi-fi, kitchen Fully Equipped Free, Free Coffee & Tea all Day.Free breakfast includes:Coffee, tea, pancakes, bread, butter, jam, eggs and fresh fruits.Also, Hotel Sloth Backpackers B & B, offers: laundry services, Office information with the best prices in activities, special for Groups and Students.2 minutes from the only public bus station,Downtown, only 2 minutes to the bus stations, banks, restaurants, night life, souvenir stores, and supermarkets.If you need me (Yorle) pick you up at the bus station, send an email.
